perturbation.original_text:
2.2 In the case of the HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks:

2.2.1 HSI will retain ownership and will grant a royalty-free, non-exclusive license to HERC to use the HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks (those foreign trademarks owned by HSI related to the ERB that incorporate the mark/name HERTZ) as set forth on Schedule A, for the Interim Period, outside the United States and Puerto Rico, as more fully set forth in the Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement attached as Exhibit A. HERC shall immediately discontinue use of the HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks upon expiration of the Interim Period, or the earlier termination of this Agreement or the Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
2.2 In the case of the HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks:

2.2.1 HSI will retain ownership but may, at its discretion, permit HERC to utilize the HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks (those foreign trademarks owned by HSI related to the ERB that incorporate the mark/name HERTZ) as set forth on Schedule A, for the Interim Period, outside the United States and Puerto Rico, as more fully set forth in the Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement attached as Exhibit A. HERC shall immediately discontinue use of the HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks upon expiration of the Interim Period, or the earlier termination of this Agreement or the Trademark, Trade Name, Domain and Related Rights License Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states HSI *will* grant a license, creating an obligation. The modified text replaces this with 'may, at its discretion, permit', making the granting of the license optional. This introduces a contradiction as to whether HERC has an assured right to use the trademarks or if it's dependent on HSI's approval.

perturbation.original_text:
3. Protection/Maintenance and Enforcement of HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks and HSI (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks during Interim Period.

3.1 During the Interim Period, HSI shall take all necessary and reasonable actions to preserve and protect the validity of the HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks, the HSI HERC Foreign ERB Trademarks and the HSI (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks licensed to HERC and HSI shall continue to prosecute all applications and maintain any registrations therefor. HERC shall not take any action that would harm or jeopardize the licensed HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks, the HSI HERC Foreign ERB Trademarks or HSI (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks.
perturbation.changed_text:
3. Protection/Maintenance and Enforcement of HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks and HSI (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks during Interim Period.

3.1 During the Interim Period, HSI may, at its discretion, take actions to preserve the HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks, the HSI HERC Foreign ERB Trademarks and the HSI (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks licensed to HERC and HSI will endeavour to continue to prosecute all applications and maintain any registrations therefor. HERC shall not take any action that would harm or jeopardize the licensed HSI (HERTZ) Foreign ERB Trademarks, the HSI HERC Foreign ERB Trademarks or HSI (HERTZ) US ERB Trademarks.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates that HSI *shall* take all necessary actions to protect trademarks. The modified version changes this to 'may, at its discretion, take actions', making it optional. Also, the original text says 'HSI shall continue', and the modified says 'HSI will endeavor to continue' which is a lower standard of obligations. This weakens HSI's obligation and creates uncertainty regarding trademark protection. The meaning becomes ambiguous.

perturbation.original_text:
8.  Breach and Termination.

8.1 By THC or HSI upon Notice. In the event of a material breach of this Agreement or any of the ancillary agreements exhibited hereto, THC or HSI may notify HERC of such material breach and terminate this Agreement upon written notice. If HERC has not cured any such breach within thirty (30) days after HERC receives such notice, this Agreement shall automatically terminate without further notice. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if the nature of the breach is such that it cannot be cured, then this Agreement shall automatically terminate upon notice of termination by THC or HSI to HERC (without any opportunity to cure the breach).
perturbation.changed_text:
8.  Breach and Termination.

8.1 By THC or HSI upon Notice. In the event of a material breach of this Agreement or any of the ancillary agreements exhibited hereto, THC or HSI may notify HERC of such material breach and terminate this Agreement upon written notice. If HERC has not cured any such breach within what THC or HSI considers to be a reasonable amount of time after HERC receives such notice, this Agreement shall terminate at the discretion of THC or HSI. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if the nature of the breach is such that it cannot be remedied, then this Agreement shall terminate if THC or HSI determines the breach warrants termination (without any opportunity to cure the breach).
perturbation.explanation: The original text defines a 30-day cure period for breaches. The modified version replaces this with 'what THC or HSI considers to be a reasonable amount of time,' making the cure period subjective and controlled by THC/HSI. Also the termination will not happen automatically, because it says 'at the discretion of THC or HSI'. This contradicts the original defined timeline and makes enforcement uncertain. Similarly the second line weakens from automatically terminate to terminate 'if THC or HSI determines'.
